intro: Cineraria aucheri, commonly known as the blueweed or cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green foliage and vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and is used in gardens and floral arrangements. Cineraria aucheri is also known for its medicinal properties, though its use is limited due to its toxic nature.
